issues.description: Condition '(S0 and S1)' can never be true because S0 and S1 are mutually exclusive state signals in a Moore FSM
suggestions: Remove the redundant condition '(S0 and S1)' from the expression
In a Moore FSM, only one state signal can be active at a time, making this condition always false
issues.reasoning: In a Moore finite state machine, state signals S0, S1, S2, and S3 are mutually exclusive - only one can be '1' at any given time. The condition '(S0 and S1)' requires both to be true simultaneously, which is impossible, making this part of the expression always evaluate to false.
